name.text: 29.2.4.21 Vector field cross product volume integral

questiontext.text:
Evaluate the integral \(\int_V (\underline{\nabla} \times \underline{F} )\mathrm{d}V\) for the case where \(\underline{F} = {@aa@}xz\underline{i} + (x^3 + y^3)\underline{j} - {@cc@}y\underline{k}\) and \(V\) is the cube \(-1 \leq x \leq 1\), \(-1 \leq y \leq 1\), \(-1 \leq z \leq 1\).

\(\displaystyle \iiint_V \underline{\nabla}\cdot \underline{F} \mathrm{d}V =\) [[input:ans1]][[validation:ans1]]\(\underline{i} +\) [[input:ans2]][[validation:ans2]] \(\underline{j} +\) [[input:ans3]][[validation:ans3]]\(\underline{k}\).

We first need to calculate \(\underline{\nabla} \times \underline{F}\): \[ \begin{aligned} \underline{\nabla} \times \underline{F} &= z=\begin{vmatrix} \underline{i} & \underline{j} & \underline{k} \\ \frac{\partial}{\partial x} & \frac{\partial}{\partial y} & \frac{\partial}{\partial z}\\ {@aa@}xz & (x^3 + y^3) & - {@cc@}y \end{vmatrix}\\ &= \left(\frac{\partial}{\partial y}(- {@cc@}y) - \frac{\partial}{\partial z}(x^3 + y^3)\right)\underline{i} - \left(\frac{\partial}{\partial x}(- {@cc@}y) - \frac{\partial}{\partial z}({@aa@}xz)\right)\underline{j} + \left(\frac{\partial}{\partial x}(x^3 + y^3) - \frac{\partial}{\partial y}({@aa@}xz)\right)\underline{k}\\ &=-{@cc@}\underline{i} + {@aa@}x\underline{j} + 3x^2\underline{k} \end{aligned} \] Then we can calculate the integral as follows: \[ \begin{aligned} \int _V \underline{F} \mathrm{d}V &= \int^{z=1}_{z=-1} \int^{y=1}_{y=-1} \int^{x=1}_{x=-1}{@expressioni@}\underline{i} +{@expressionj@}\underline{j} + {@expressionk@}\underline{k} \ \mathrm{d}x\ \mathrm{d}y\ \mathrm{d}z\\ &= \int^{z=1}_{z=-1} \int^{y=1}_{y=-1} \left[{@ia_indef@}\underline{i} +{@ja_indef@}\underline{j} + {@ka_indef@}\underline{k}\right]^{x=1}_{x=-1}\ \mathrm{d}y\ \mathrm{d}z\\ &= \int^{z=1}_{z=-1} \int^{y=1}_{y=-1}{@ia_def@}\underline{i} +{@ja_def@}\underline{j} + {@ka_def@}\underline{k} \ \mathrm{d}y\ \mathrm{d}z\\ &= \int^{z=1}_{z=-1} \left[{@ib_indef@}\underline{i} +{@jb_indef@}\underline{j} + {@kb_indef@}\underline{k}\right]^{y=1}_{y=-1}\ \mathrm{d}z\\ &= \int^{z=1}_{z=-1} {@ib_def@}\underline{i} +{@jb_def@}\underline{j} + {@kb_def@}\underline{k}\ \mathrm{d}z\\ &=\left[{@ic_indef@}\underline{i} +{@jc_indef@}\underline{j} + {@kc_indef@}\underline{k}\right]^{z=1}_{z=-1}\\ &={@ic_def@}\underline{i} +{@jc_def@}\underline{j} + {@kc_def@}\underline{k} \end{aligned} \]
